titleStmt.title: The welspring of sciences, which teacheth the perfecte worke and practise of arithmeticke both in vvhole numbers & fractions, with such easie and compendious instruction into the saide art, as hath not heretofore been by any set out nor laboured, : Beautified vvith most necessary rules and questions, not onely profitable for marchauntes, but also for all artificers, as in the table doth plainely appere..
Well spring of sciences
titleStmt.author: Baker, Humfrey, fl. 1557-1587.
Denham, Henry, d. 1589?
Rowbothum, James.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Henry Denham, for Iames Rowbothum.,

notesStmt.note: Printed as pages; numbered as leaves.
Reproduction of original in: British Library.
